action.action-desc: Mr. Cole introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To reduce Federal spending and the deficit by terminating taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns.

section.header: Termination of taxpayer financing of presidential election campaigns

subsection.header: Termination of designation of income tax payments
subsection.text: Section 6096 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
This section shall not apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

paragraph.header: Termination of presidential election campaign fund

subparagraph.text: Chapter 95 of subtitle H of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.text: The provisions of this chapter shall not apply with respect to any presidential election (or any presidential nominating convention) after the date of the enactment of this section, or to any candidate in such an election.

subparagraph.text: Section 9006 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Transfer of funds remaining after termination
subsection.text: Of the amounts in the fund as of the date of the enactment of this subsectionâ€”

paragraph.text: the Secretary shall transfer $88,202,400 to the 10-Year Pediatric Research Initiative Fund described in section 9008(i)(2), to be available as described in such section; and
the Secretary shall transfer the remainder to the general fund of the Treasury, to be used only for reducing the deficit.
Chapter 96 of subtitle H of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.text: The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to any candidate with respect to any presidential election after the date of the enactment of this section.
